The Sweethome and The Wirecutter are lists of the best gadgets and gear for people who quickly want to know what to get. When readers choose to buy our independently chosen editorial picks, we earn affiliate commissions that support our work. Here is an explanation of exactly what we do, and how to support our work.

The Best Knife-Sharpening Tool

Chef’sChoice ProntoPro 4643
After 15 hours of research and testing, and several adult lifetimes of kitchen experience, we recommend the manual Chef’sChoice ProntoPro 4643 knife sharpener. Tomatoes (and everything else) don’t stand a chance.

New Things
  • We hand-pick and analyze our deals to the point of obsession. Follow us on Twitter at @sweethomedeals to see any updates we make throughout the day.
    Here are the top 10 guides Sweethome readers are looking at this week.
  • May 24, 2016
    The Best Eyelash Curler
    We tested nine eyelash curlers, and the Shiseido Eyelash Curler remains the best one for most people. Our diverse test panel found that it created smooth curls without crimping lashes or pinching skin.
  • The Best Serrated Knife
    We spent over 15 hours researching and testing serrated knives, and the well-made, versatile Victorinox Fibrox Pro 10.25-Inch Serrated Curved Bread Knife beat knives that cost three times as much.
  • May 23, 2016

    * Best Deals: Our runner-up pick for the best reel mower, the Fiskars Staysharp Max Reel Mower, 18-Inch, is down to $143 (from $185) [Amazon]

  • May 20, 2016

    * Best Deals: Our pick for the best hex wrenches, the TEKTON 25282 26-piece Long Arm Ball Hex Key Wrench Set, are down to $11 (from $16) [Amazon]

  • Inner Vision for the Weekend of May 20, 2016

    * In this weekend’s edition of Inner Vision, learn how to make a healthier and lower-calorie version of table sugar imparted with the taste of caramel, organize your tab collection by site and time visited with a browser extension, and be amazed at how easy it is to determine if a gas grill’s propane tank is in need of replacement.

How we work

We help support the hundreds of hours that go into our evaluations through affiliate commissions on purchases made through our links. We’re committed to publishing unbiased guides that clearly detail our decision-making criteria to our readers, but we just want you to know.

Here's how to support our writers and our work. For more on our ethics, ideas and how we work, read this. We obtain the products we review through a mixture of buying our own and working with companies to borrow review units. Our policy is to return or donate products after we’re finished working with them.

Find an error?: Also, If you notice a guide that needs a little freshening up, or has errors, please tweet us at @homesweethome or email us at notes@thesweethome.com and we'll fix it. Thank you.
